captions.text: - I didn't, yeah, you go ahead.

- [Girl] I Ned just going
to watch me get coffee?

- Oh, yeah, yeah, I was
about to ask you that.
Why did he sit next to me
when there are all these empty chairs?
- You know what this meeting is about?
- Yeah, I just prepared a little bit.
- Oh my god, are you still hungover?
- I can barely move from place to place.
(whispers) I think he's obsessed with me!
- (laughing) I have a very small bladder!
Um, Ned was looking for you.

- [Girl] He's finally ready
to tell me his true feelings!
- I think he just wanted you
to email him notes on that meeting.

- Mm, you should join the
company softball team.
- I don't know how to throw things!
to spend time with me outside of work?
You know how to throw things?
He wants to see me outside of work!

- Ned had a lot of really
great things to say about you!

Maybe Ned thinks our boss
wants us to fall in love.

- Yeah, he said you really
just took initiative
and took control of that last project.

I should just grab him and
kiss him in Conference Room B.

- [Boss] Uh, this way
to our meeting, Allison.
I was just thinking about the project.
- [Allison] I bet he planned his exit
so it would be at the same time as me!

Do you think Justin and
Quinta are secretly dating?
- I don't think anyone would care.

- Oh, hey, do you want
to get drinks later?
Oh, man, thanks for coming, Allison.
You got a hot date later or something?
- Hey, everybody, cool boss is here.

title: Is He Flirting Or Just Being Nice?

comments.author: Bendik Sogge Røtnes

comments.text:
i could see this happening in reverse (aka the guy thinking she's flirting 
with him) because women are much more subtle when they flirt most of the 
time. but men are usually pretty direct when it comes to our flirting. so 
in the examples given in this video, i would say that her taking what he 
does as flirting is a bit of a stretch. especially because many of the 
examples shown include him acting the same way toward someone else, even 
other men.
       so if a guy treats his "bros" the same way he's treating you as 
shown in this video, chances are that he's just being friendly and not 
flirting. the only thing he did here that could be taken as showing 
romantic interest is when he asks her if she wants to go out for drinks 
without mentioning that there would be other people there. but i think they 
made him act ambiguously in that example on purpose for this video. because 
who the hell asks someone to join the group to go for drinks after work 
without mentioning that they would be going with a group of people? no one, 
that's who XD﻿

because we actually are interested in being friends with you. I also hate 
the stigma of the 'friend zone'. Especially guys' view of it. Why is the 
'friend zone' a bad thing? It is really great to have both male and female 
friends. Today's society is warped when it comes to relationships. Everyone 
is wanting sex sex sex.﻿

comments.text:
Moment 1:54 - girl brain shark jump. Ladies: avoid moment 1:54 at all 
costs. However, I know so many supposedly interested-entire-time dudes who 
do moment 2:38 to women all the time then wonder why we put them in the 
friend zone. Derp: because we didn't; YOU did. If Alison wants to know if 
mixed signals liked her, she should date a hotter guy. Mixed Signals'll get 
clear as a bell instantly; never fails. But you can't pretend. You have to 
genuinely want that new guy. The exact moment you really do, guess who 
always shows up.﻿

comments.author: scholesyfan

comments.text:
I think Buzzfeed just wrote a sitcom about my life. I used to have a huge 
crush on a guy at work. He was always so friendly and nice, and we joked a 
lot. I was always questioning his motives and what they meant, just like 
this video lol (embarrassing to admit that). But he never asked me out and 
I never had the guts to ask him, so I just assumed he didn't find me 
attractive and only saw me as a friend, which is fine. But it's really 
funny because two of my work friends have said they had a bit of a crush on 
him too LOL. He has a lot of charisma. I will always find him attractive 
but that's the end of it. TL:DR; I relate to this video SO MUCH and it's 
kind of embarrassing how much I overthink.... BLAH!﻿

comments.text:
I need help :(
So I like a boy who is 1 year older than me, but I don't know him. The 
thing is I sometimes catch him seeing me and the day I started liking him 
my mom told me she saw him smiling at me. Some of my friends know him, 
including my BFF. Does he like me? But wait. I have another thing to tell. 
One of my friends knows him and it's actually a boy, (I don't like him btw 
but I used to) and he to.d me that the boy I like is actually a bit dumb. 
But my BFF told me that he's a good person. WHAT THE HECK?! Does he like 
me?! Anyway, please give me some tips so I can actually meet him :(

Ty dear person who is reading this for reading it :)

P.S: The guy who told me he's a bit dumb told me that he likes my friend. 
#confusion﻿
